column1: id,"blog","category","markdown"

16769,"WN640","Software","The French initiative to build a geolocated street level image sharing service has [voted](https://forum.geocommuns.fr/t/des-noms-pour-le-projet/48) :FR-s: to name the project Panoramax, which is both a wordplay on panorama, maximum and Panoramix, the original name of Getafix from the Asterix series. One can follow the project's development on this [forum](https://forum.geocommuns.fr/c/panoramax/6) :FR-s:."

18318,"WN686","Did you know that…","... [GeoVisio](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/GeoVisio), also known as Panoramax, is a Street View gallery server software that is libre and open source and that you can host on your own server?"

18637,"WN695","Events","Christian Quest, founding member of the French OpenStreetMap local chapter, [introduced](https://mstdn.io/@lefuturiste/111392720631545134) the Panoramax project during the [State of the Map EU 2023](https://stateofthemap.eu/program/panoramax-the-full-floss-alternative-for-your-ground-level-imagery) event. Panoramax is a decentralised and federated project to collect and share ground level imagery under open licences."

19116,"WN704","Programming","Lucas Longour [created](https://lucaslongour.org/posts/2024-01-12-panoramax-userjs-for-openstreetmap/) some userscripts to display [Panoramax](https://panoramax.fr/) links on OpenStreetMap and overpass turbo."

19339,"WN711","Programming","Adrien Pavie has [shared](https://framapiaf.org/@PanierAvide/112038222954469129) a tutorial to help users create custom models for object recognition in Panoramax photos. The tutorial [walks](https://github.com/panoramax-project/DetectionTutorial)  users through the process of creating a dataset, marking up photos, training the YOLOv8 model, and recognising objects in new photos."

19375,"WN712","Community","Deus Figendi [called](https://t.me/OSM_de/110146) :DE-s: for more use of [Panoramax](https://lucaslongour.org/posts/2024-01-12-panoramax-userjs-for-openstreetmap/). Paul [explained](https://t.me/OSM_de/110149) :DE-s: Panoramax in a nutshell: 'Street pictures à la Kartaview/Mapillary, but technically like Mastodon'. Christian Quest [explained](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vh87F5Zie6k) it in detail in a video from SotM Europe 2023."

19421,"WN713","Community","OSM France [called](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/massive-mapillary-takeout-for-panoramax/110693) out to Mapillary users who would like their photos to be migrated to the libre street view alternative Panoramax, which is hosted by OSM France."

19481,"WN714","Did you know that…","… that the main difference between the two federating [Panoramax](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/GeoVisio) instances is the licence being applied to the uploaded images? [IGN](https://panoramax.ign.fr/) is using the [etalab-2.0](https://www.etalab.gouv.fr/licence-ouverte-open-licence/) :FR-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-etalab-gouv-fr.translate.goog/licence-ouverte-open-licence/?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN)  licence and [OSM-FR](https://panoramax.openstreetmap.fr/) is [CC-BY-SA-4.0](https://spdx.org/licenses/CC-BY-SA-4.0.html). OSM-FR is [accepting](https://en.osm.town/@cquest@amicale.net/112163274315316670) images from outside of France, so that local communities can test Panoramax with the goal of having them deploy their own instance in the near future."

19548,"WN716","Community","In the second week of their EU Camera Grant project Anne-Karoline Distel has [uploaded](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/b-unicycling/diary/403852) around 30,000 images, using a GoPro Max, experimenting with different modes of transportation including cycling, walking, and taking the bus to capture imagery. Despite weather challenges, their efforts were enhanced by using an e-bike, allowing for broader coverage. They also discussed the project in a local radio interview and began testing uploads to Panoramax."

19631,"WN717","Mapping campaigns","GoWin [wrote](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/GOwin/diary/403933) about a craft mapping campaign with students from the University of Bohol, Indonesia. The on-site observations were recorded on [fieldpapers](http://fieldpapers.org/). The georeferenced photos, collected with [OpenCamera](https://www.opencamera.org.uk/), were uploaded to [Panoramax](https://api.panoramax.xyz/#focus=map&map=16.16/9.641211/123.85648&pic=b4c47ca0-4684-4a44-8d23-d5d95a2b3b9b&speed=250&xyz=275.00/0.00/30)."

19651,"WN718","Community","Branko Kokanovic [shared](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Branko%20Kokanovic/diary/403952) a detailed guide to optimising the use of the Insta360 ONE RS 1-inch camera for capturing and uploading street-level imagery to Mapillary, including tips on camera handling, video splitting, and improving GPS tracking accuracy using software solutions such as Geoapify for map matching. The images can also be uploaded to [Panoramax](https://panoramax.fr/)."

19645,"WN718","OSM in the media","[1] ZDNet [reviewed](https://www.zdnet.fr/blogs/l-esprit-libre/commun-numerique-panoramax-une-base-de-photos-de-vues-de-terrain-immersives-390872.htm) :FR-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-zdnet-fr.translate.goog/blogs/l-esprit-libre/commun-numerique-panoramax-une-base-de-photos-de-vues-de-terrain-immersives-390872.htm?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) Panoramax, the digital commons platform, sponsored by IGN and OpenStreetMap France, which offers a free alternative to services such as Google StreetView. It features nearly 18 million terrain view photos contributed by various entities and aims to provide an open, decentralised system for sharing geolocated, ground-level photos under free licences that can be used for various applications, including urban infrastructure management."
19683,"WN718","Picture","![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/718_TM_all.png =672x639)
Panoramax.fr - The free alternative for photo-mapping territories [[^1^](#wn718_30480)]
19666,"WN718","Upcoming Events","

column7: 19869,WN723","Programming","Mattia Pezzotti, a Google Summer of Code 2024 participant, [presented](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Juicio/diary/404174) their project for integrating Panoramax imagery into the iD editor. The project aims to enhance map exploration by incorporating 360-degree imagery, providing users with valuable visual context and improving map visualisation and community engagement."

column1: 19892,"WN724","OSM in the media","_ZDNET_ [published](https://www.zdnet.fr/blogs/l-esprit-libre/libre-et-open-source-express-openstreetmap-panoramax-signal-murena-mentorat-392390.htm) :FR-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-zdnet-fr.translate.goog/blogs/l-esprit-libre/libre-et-open-source-express-openstreetmap-panoramax-signal-murena-mentorat-392390.htm?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) a series of articles covering the topics of open data and open source. They specifically highlighted the SotM-FR, which is being held on the last three days of June in Lyon, and the growth of the Panoramax project, which is being built by a partnership between the IGN and OSM France."

19968,"WN726","Events","Christian Quest [presented](https://peertube.openstreetmap.fr/w/dEZDnmG9pgtCNcCXA7SpmF) :FR-s: the special keynote 'Panoramax: l'alernative libre pour photo-cartographier nos territoires' (Panoramax: the free alternative for photo-mapping our territories)  at the [festival](https://passageenseine.fr/) :FR-s: 'Pas Sage en Seine'  (PSES 2024) and showed the [Panoramax](https://panoramax.fr/) :FR-s: resources and the prospects for the future of the project."

20079,"WN728","Other Geo Things","The initial release of the Panoramax Android app, [announced](https://lemmy.ml/post/17392892) at the State of the Map France 2024, offers an alpha/beta version available for [download](https://github.com/nobelization/panoramax-mobile-app/releases/tag/release-beta) as an APK, and will be published on the Play Store and F-Droid. The app allows users to contribute geolocated photos to the Panoramax database, a free alternative to Google Street View for OpenStreetMap."

20129,"WN729","Programming","Mattia Pezzotti is [documenting](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Juicio/diary/404174) his progress in integrating Panoramax with OpenStreetMap as part of Google Summer of Code 2024, providing weekly updates on new features and improvements such as viewing 360-degree images, adding filters, and improving the user interface. This ongoing project was previously [covered](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/17244#wn723_30687) in weeklyOSM 723."
20177,"WN730","Upcoming Events","

column7: 20464,WN736","Software","Martin Raifer [discussed](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/tyr_asd/diary/404900) the recent updates to the OpenStreetMap iD editor including the addition of Panoramax support for street-level imagery, new tagging schema guidelines, and upcoming features such as a building mapping mode, as well as community contributions and upcoming events."

column1: 20495,"WN737","Community","Bastian Greshake Tzovaras [wrote](https://tzovar.as/open-source-streetview/) about why Panoramax is an important contribution to the open source mapping landscape."

20501,"WN737","Releases","Beta 1.1.0 of the Panoramax Android app has been [released](https://github.com/nobelization/panoramax-mobile-app/releases/tag/v1.1.0-beta). It allows you to conveniently contribute street images to the open Street View alternative from your mobile phone. The release has an APK [attached](https://github.com/nobelization/panoramax-mobile-app/releases/download/v1.1.0-beta/app-release.apk), in case you want to give it a try."

20555,"WN738","Software","Cartes [reported](https://cartes.app/blog/street-view-france) :FR-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://cartes-app.translate.goog/blog/street-view-france?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) that they have recently [integrated](https://cartes.app) :FR-s: Panoramax, a self-hosted, open-source street view platform, into their app."

20585,"WN739","OSM in the media","Radio France, the French national public radio broadcaster, [highlighted](https://www.radiofrance.fr/franceinfo/podcasts/nouveau-monde/panoramax-le-projet-citoyen-initie-par-l-institut-national-de-l-information-geographique-et-forestiere-ign-pour-ne-plus-dependre-de-google-street-view-9690514) :FR-s:>>>[:EN-t:](https://www-radiofrance-fr.translate.goog/franceinfo/podcasts/nouveau-monde/panoramax-le-projet-citoyen-initie-par-l-institut-national-de-l-information-geographique-et-forestiere-ign-pour-ne-plus-dependre-de-google-street-view-9690514?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) the Panoramax project – an initiative by IGN and OSM France to gather geolocated street-level photographs contributed by citizens."
20703,"WN742","Software","A new Panoramax [instance](https://en.osm.town/@MapComplete/113209991694821771) for MapComplete is now [available](https://panoramax.mapcomplete.org/)."

20713,"WN743","Programming","Tykayn has improved their Mapillary [export](https://forge.chapril.org/tykayn/mapillary_download) script to be able to retrieve Mapillary sequences from multiple users and import them into Panoramax in bulk.  They offered to do this for anyone who wanted it, and were able to rescue over 14 million photos.  Tykayn gave a [presentation](https://peertube.openstreetmap.fr/w/tHdpBPWq3TJb21wmVhCM6i)  :FR-s: >   [:EN-t:](https://peertube-openstreetmap-fr.translate.goog/w/tHdpBPWq3TJb21wmVhCM6i?_x_tr_sl=auto&_x_tr_tl=EN) explaining the implications and methods used at the State of the Map France."

20767,"WN744","Community","Negreheb [blogged](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Negreheb/diary/405306) about his project to capture 360° images of the city of Salzburg, Austria, for Mapillary and possibly for Panoramax."

20753,"WN744","Releases","Christian Quest, from OSM-France, [presented](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/a-bunch-of-news-about-panoramax/120587) several new features of Panoramax [2.7](https://panoramax.openstreetmap.fr). The new features include a user leaderboard and an updated upload API, which handles sequence splitting and duplicate image removal. Christian also announced that ESRI has worked on integrating Panoramax into its ArcGIS software. Panoramax is an open-source platform that provides geolocated street imagery via a decentralised architecture, similar to Google Street View, but self-hosted and without restrictive use conditions. There are several Panoramax instances, including the French and global versions, where users can upload images and share them via APIs."

20964,"WN748","Community","Pieter Vander Vennet [detailed](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Pieter%20Vander%20Vennet/diary/405598) the transition of MapComplete's image hosting from Imgur to Panoramax, citing changes to Imgur's terms of use and functionality, while encouraging the wider adoption of Panoramax for OpenStreetMap projects."

20965,"WN748","Events","Save the date for the first monthly online Panoramax [meeting](https://forum.geocommuns.fr/t/first-monthly-online-panoramax-meeting-in-english-on-nov-25th/1981), in English, on Monday 25 November at 16:00 UTC."

20971,"WN748","OSM in action","There are two Geoguessr-like games based on Panoramax images available, [PANOGUESSR](https://panoguessr.com) :FR-s: and [PanoramaxGuessr](https://panoramaxguessr.k327.eu/)."

20970,"WN748","Releases","A new beta version of the Panoramax Android app, for taking street-level photos, has been [released](https://github.com/nobelization/panoramax-mobile-app/releases/tag/v1.2.1-beta)."

20987,"WN749","Community","Pieter Vander Vennet [highlighted](https://en.osm.town/@pietervdvn/113545933237913459) a collaborative ecosystem of OpenStreetMap tools, as shown in Paul Dassori's screenshot from Valdivia, Chile. The iD editor displays orange dots representing locations with images available via Panoramax, a federated system integrating Panoramax.xyz, Panoramax MapComplete, and contributions from MapComplete users like Awo, showcasing a rich dataset of geolocated photos."

20992,"WN749","Events","The first Panoramax monthly online meeting took place on Monday 25 November, [gathering](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/panoramax-monthly-meeting-in-english-on-nov-25th/121611) contributors to discuss updates, community insights, and plans for the federated geospatial image platform. Highlights included feature development, collaboration opportunities, and goals for expanding usage. [Watch](https://peertube.openstreetmap.fr/w/nCz1ShqeRseQp5PHx686nw) the screencast or [review](https://cryptpad.fr/code/#/2/code/view/U8d5lgxK-l1dLxBkROTVPmarY+nOhg+qlQzmnjWgAAI/) the minutes. The next meeting is scheduled for Tuesday 17 December."

21083,"WN751","Community","Projets Libres! [recently](https://www.projets-libres.org/en/an-introduction-to-the-openstreetmap-project-c-quest/) featured an in-depth interview with Christian Quest, delving into the history and evolution of OpenStreetMap. The conversation explored its origins, governance, licensing, and international growth, while highlighting the role of communities and institutions in supporting the project. Christian emphasised the importance of 'gardening' the OSM database to ensure its accuracy and relevance, and he shared insights into related projects including Panoramax. The discussion also touched on OSM’s role in humanitarian crises and its integration with open data initiatives."

21084,"WN751","Software","TrickyFoxy has [updated](https://en.osm.town/@foxy/113633788148829766) their script [better-osm-org](https://github.com/deevroman/better-osm-org/), adding a dark mode for iD, improving the changeset view mode by adding an edit war detector, searching for changesets by hashtags, and making values of `panoramax=` and `mapillary=` tags clickable. A detailed list of changes can be [found](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/better-osm-org-a-script-that-adds-useful-little-things-to-osm-org/121670/8) on the OSM Community forum."

21102,"WN752","Events","Bastian Greshake Tzovaras gave a [talk](https://scholar.social/@gedankenstuecke/113627884569900395) :ES-s: about citizen science and how it relates to OSM and Panoramax at the National University in Río Cuarto, Argentina on 11 December. The slides have been [published](https://tzovar.as/cs-mapping-talk-unrc/) under an open licence."

21179,"WN754","Releases","Alexis Lecanu [announced](https://forum.openstreetmap.fr/t/baba-nouvelle-application-pour-contribuer-a-panoramax/29948) :FR-s: that Baba, a new Panoramax client for Android, can be [downloaded](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.ravenfeld.panoramax.baba) from Google Play, and since it is the first version, he is asking people to [report](https://gitlab.com/ravenfeld/baba) on GitLab any problems they encounter."
21174,"WN754","Upcoming Events","

column7: 21244,WN755","Events","Christian Quest [revealed](https://community.openstreetmap.org/t/panoramax-at-fosdem-2025/124055) that Panoramax will have a booth at FOSDEM 2025 in Brussels, Belgium, taking place on 1 and 2 February, located on the second floor of the K2 building (K2-A-4). There will also be a [presentation](https://fosdem.org/2025/schedule/event/fosdem-2025-4448-panoramax-the-full-floss-alternative-to-share-ground-level-imagery/) about Panoramax, a full FLOSS alternative for ground-level imagery sharing, on Saturday at 11:50 CET in room AW1.120. Attendees can expect some goodies at the booth."

column7: 21281,WN756","Other Geo Things","Christopher Beddow has [looked](https://worldbuilder.substack.com/p/street-view-a-history) at how street-level imagery has changed over time. He started by investigating the early 20th century with city recordings and goes on to discuss Google Street View and similar services today. He talked about important moments including the Aspen Movie Map (1978), early road surveys, and the CityBlock project at Stanford. This project was the first step in creating street view and similar services. Now there are other options such as  Mapillary and Panoramax, which use open-source and crowdsourcing methods. With new developments in computer vision and LiDAR, we can expect even more realistic 3D maps and experiences that we may be able to view on more than just our phones and computers."

column1: 21321,"WN756","Releases","Baba, the Panoramax Android app, has been [updated](https://gitlab.com/ravenfeld/baba/-/releases/1.4.0) to version 1.4.0. Upload progress is now shown in the notification and failed uploads can be sent again."

column7: 21347,WN757","Community","Anne-Karoline Distel, a [violinist](https://thedublinersexperience.com/the-dubliners-experience-band/) in 'The Dubliners Experience' band, is [touring](https://thedublinersexperience.com/events) the Netherlands, [capturing](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/b-unicycling/diary/405998) street-level images, and [uploading](https://panoramax.openstreetmap.fr/#background=streets&date_from=2025-01-16&focus=map&map=7.74/52.188/5.36&speed=250&theme=score) them to Panoramax."

column1: 21326,"WN757","Programming","Ilya Zverev is trying to improve EveryDoor by developing a process for uploading photos from mobile to Panoramax and [asked](https://gitlab.com/panoramax/server/api/-/issues/227) about the OAuth authentication process."
21334,"WN757","Releases","Vespucci [hinted](https://en.osm.town/@vespucci_editor/113821962898455509) at the addition of Panoramax support as a new feature in their upcoming version 21.0 release."

21362,"WN758","Mapping campaigns","Negreheb [shared](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Negreheb/diary/406030) the progress being made on capturing Salzburg’s streets with 360° imagery for Mapillary and Panoramax. Challenges with route planning tools led to using OsmAnd for real-time GPX tracking and flexibility. They highlighted improvements using CLI tools for image uploads, ensuring efficiency and quality. Inspired by Detroit’s street coverage success, they aim to map all streets in Salzburg to improve OpenStreetMap and accessibility."
21390,"WN758","Upcoming Events","

column7: 21410,WN759","Community","Anne-Karoline Distel [recapped](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/b-unicycling/diary/406074) her mapping contributions made while touring the Netherlands with a band (we [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/17700#wn757_32175) earlier). Using a GoPro Max, she captured 360° imagery along motorways and concert venues, significantly improving the coverage on Panoramax. She also mapped thatched buildings, defibrillators, and backstage amenities in theatres, adding missing shops, streetlights, and other details. Despite the limited daylight, Anne-Karoline ranked number 56 in Dutch OSM contributions."

column1: 21418,"WN759","Releases","Version 1.5.1 of Baba for Android has been [released](https://gitlab.com/ravenfeld/baba/-/releases/1.5.1). It is used to contribute to the [Panoramax](https://panoramax.fr/) project and new features include the resumption of recordings interrupted by calls and setting the image orientation."

21414,"WN759","Releases","TrickyFoxy [outlined](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/TrickyFoxy/diary/406061) the new features of their better-osm-org browser [userscript](https://github.com/deevroman/better-osm-org/), for adding additional functionality to the OpenStreetMap website. This update implements the display of photos associated with StreetComplete notes, and the `panoramax= ` and `wikimedia_commons= ` tags. Also added are the display of users' GPS tracks on the map and when opening notes from StreetComplete. The changesets history page now displays the first comment to a changeset. You can read about the other functions of the script in their other [diary](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/TrickyFoxy/diary/) entries."

column7: 21448,WN760","Maps","^\[1\]^ -karlos- (aka DerKarlos) has [revived](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/-karlos-/diary/406090) his old 3D-rendered OpenStreetMap project 'OSM go' by integrating Panoramax images after Mapillary's API shutdown, and is now exploring other improvements, including better 3D rendering techniques and possibly rewriting the project in Rust or Zig. You can [view](https://osmgo.org/go.html?km=1&lat=52.516275&lon=13.377232&ele=18.15&dir=-100&view=-19) the [Brandenburg Gate](https://www.openstreetmap.org/way/518071791), one of Germany's most famous [landmarks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brandenburg_Gate). There is an 'OSM go' project page on the OSM [wiki](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/OSM_go) and at [GitLab](https://gitlab.com/DerKarlos/osmgo)."

column1: 21469,"WN760","Releases","Version 1.6.0 of the Panoramax Android app Baba has been [released](https://gitlab.com/ravenfeld/baba/-/releases/1.6.0). This version brings GNSS support for phones without Google services, better notifications for picture uploads, and allows saving to external storage."

column7: 21541,WN763","Releases","Alexis Lecanu [announced](https://gitlab.com/ravenfeld/baba/-/releases/1.7.0) the release of version 1.7.0 of [Baba](https://gitlab.com/ravenfeld/baba), an Android and iOS application designed for contributing to the [Panoramax](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Panoramax) project."

column7: 21666,WN766","Education","Raquel Dezidério Souto has [written](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Raquel%20Dezid%C3%A9rio%20Souto/diary/406430) a short guide showing how to map trees in OpenStreetMap with MapComplete and visualise them in three different ways (with Panoramax, overpass turbo, or uMap). This guide will serve as support material for the field mapping activities that will take place as part of Green Open Data Day 2025 or for general instructions."
